THE FORD FOUNDATION
-477 MADISON AVENUE
NEW YORK 22, N. Y.
JOSEPH M. McDANIEL, JR.
secretary
May 6, 1959
Mr. Frank E. Schooley, President
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
Ik Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr. Schooley:
I wish to refer to my letter of June 27, 1957, in which
I advised you that The Ford Foundation had approved a grant of
$97,000 to the National Association of Educational Broadcasters
to support projects in the further professional development of
education by television and radio. The grant supplemented a previous
Foundation grant in the amount of $9^,000 made for this project, of
which youwsre advised by my letter of May 21, 1956. It was made
in support of activities of the fiscal year 1957-1958*
I am now pleased to advise you that, in response to your
letters of March 30 and April 27, 1959 to Mr. James W. Armsey of
the Foundation staff, the terms of this grant have been modified,
extending the period of the grant for approximately two years
beyond the original termination date so that the funds may be used
during the fiscal year 1959-1960.
All other terms and conditions of the grant remain
unchanged from those set forth in my letter of June 27, 1957*
Sincerely yours,
cc: Mr. Harry J. Skornia
